snp1.1:2.3: Here the “near shore and the far” means “this life and the next”.
snp1.1:7.1: The commentary interprets _vitakka_ as “wrong thoughts”, but the identical line at [ud6.7:4.1]() clearly refers to _jhāna_. The commentary also reads _vidhūpitā_ as “burning up”, but _vidhūpa_ refers to clearing the mist, smoke, or incense.
snp1.1:9.2: Bodhi, Norman, and Ṭhānissaro all render _vitatha_ as “unreal”. This seems overly idealistic for early Buddhism, so I take the prefix _vi_ in the sense of “distorts”, “twists”.
